HeroDescription: Senior lecturer at Seminar Hakibbutzim College, physical education teacher in high schools in Tel Aviv. Visiting professor at the University of Calgary in Canada.
AboutSubtitle: “There is no love like the love of muscle” Yigal Pinchas, Ph.D.
AboutMain:
Many of my friends and students asked me to write about my challenging, surprising, and inspiring life story...

Until the age of 18 (recruitment age), I grew up for 14 years in various boarding school settings. I learned silence from the chatterboxes, kindness from the cruel-hearted, and patience from the impatient. To my greatest surprise, I am not grateful to these teachers of mine.

Nevertheless, I've come to realize that necessity is the mother of invention, that to know how to get up you must not fear falling, and that patience is bitter but its fruit is sweet!

I chose to write and focus on the "toolbox containing tools for life" - these tools are the strengths and powers in the holistic approach I developed throughout my life. This approach first proved its effectiveness to me in promoting a healthy and active lifestyle, and later contributed greatly to those around me. Many of his friends and students asked me to write

This holistic approach not only benefited me and those close to me, but also profoundly impacted the readers of my books. Many of them shared with me how the tools I presented helped them deal with life's challenges more effectively. My readers reported significant improvement in their ability to identify their personal strengths and use them as leverage for growth. They learned to see obstacles as opportunities for developing creative solutions, just as I learned that "necessity is the mother of invention."

MultimediaInfo: The following courses: Anatomy, Physiology, Kinesiology, Theoretical Physical Fitness, Training Sciences, Gyms, Practical Physical Fitness, and Biomechanics are mostly mandatory courses in the training process of teacher candidates in the School for Advanced Studies, the School for Advanced Learning, the School of Physical Education and Movement, the Faculty of Medicine specializing in Physiotherapy studies, and in the Faculty of Kinesiology, and more...
The literature on these subjects is extensive and very expensive.
These are complex subjects that require deep understanding, extensive memorization,  visual perception, and in many cases, abstract thinking and three-dimensional conceptualization abilities.

In addition, we are witnessing a "sitting culture" and its negative aspects (obesity, increase in heart and vascular diseases, laziness, etc.). Lack of knowledge and motivation for physical activity also cause negative side effects: failure to achieve training goals, sports injuries, waste of time, and eventually even dropping out of physical activity.
For this purpose, a tool has been developed to assist in learning, spark curiosity, and increase enjoyment and insights from the combination of different fields of knowledge.

Therefore, we decided to develop an extensive multimedia guide worth $300,000 which will be a winning combination between academic research knowledge in the fields of human body sciences and thoughtful, intelligent practice that will lead to a healthy lifelong journey.
